items.sentence: The only thing Tom does nowadays is watch TV.
Neither Tom nor Mary has a Canadian passport.
I've never heard Tom complain about anything.
I'm the one who recommended Tom for this job.
I'm the one who recommended Tom for that job.
I wonder how long Tom will stay in Australia.
I wonder how Tom will answer Mary's question.
I waited for Tom to apologize, but he didn't.
I really do hate the way Tom makes spaghetti.
I heard that Tom was being bullied at school.
I don't know who Tom gave his old bicycle to.
Tom put the scissors back in his desk drawer.
Tom promised to pay me three hundred dollars.
Tom promised to give me everything we needed.
Tom passed his driving test on his first try.
Tom opened the door and turned on the lights.
Tom never imagined he'd own his own business.
Tom needed to talk to Mary about the problem.
Tom moved to Boston last winter from Chicago.
Tom knew the answer, but didn't say anything.
